item.title: Building site has fencing open across the pavement, 16th June
item.description:
Building site at 59 Lion Road DA6 8NW has blocked the public footpath all day as they have opened the fencing onto the pavement. No signage to say footpath closed & no attempt to make a footway for pedestrians to walk safely in the road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lion Road, Blendon, London

item.description:

item.title: A completely full and abandoned rubbish bin, left without the proper authorisations or permissions., 16th June
item.description:
These rubbish bins have been in this condition for several days now – extremely full, with the lids left open – attracting rats and insects, and releasing a terrible stench of rotting waste and leftover food. We have also witnessed people discarding lithium batteries and e-cigarettes into these bins, which poses a serious fire risk. Furthermore, these bins do not belong in this area, which is private property. No permission or request has been made by any of the tenants of the railway arches where these bins are currently located. We kindly request that you come to remove the waste as soon as possible, and also take away the bins, which have been left here without any authorisation, on private land.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 81, Norwood Road, Herne Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: One metre high concrete bollard broken at 'S' bend on Old Paradise street, 16th June
item.description:
Car crashed into concrete bollard snapping it but for the steel reinforcement bar holding it off the ground. Children after school play on it and I fear the steel are will snap and harm someone.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Paradise Street, Lambeth, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Various potholes making a Monmouth Close dangerous, 16th June
item.description:
I wanted to bring to your attention the worsening condition of the pot holes in Monmouth Close. These pot holes have become increasingly problematic, and there is one particularly deep one outside house number 28. It has become quite hazardous, and my parents have nearly fallen when getting out of the passenger seat tripping up. The Close now feels like a white-knuckle ride, and it is only a matter of time before a child or pet gets hit by a vehicle as drivers have to swerve to avoid the numerous pot holes. Could you please take immediate action to address this issue before it leads to any serious accidents? Your prompt attention to this matter would be greatly appreciated. Thank you for your understanding and cooperation.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Monmouth Close, Welling, London
Report on FixMyStreet
